result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[ae] cases 22CF210 and 22CF211 called 10:34 AM Defendant Daven Devonte Allen in court.  Defendant Hayli M Phelps in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Right to Counsel given

As to 22CF210: The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct.

The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--not to discuss the case with co-defendant outside the presence of counsel
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)
